byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah reported from Kandahar, and Rod Nordland from Kabul, Afghanistan. Fazal Muzhary contributed reporting from Kabul.
byline.original: By TAIMOOR SHAH and ROD NORDLAND

abstract: Afghan government confirms that Afghan National Army Helicopter crashed in southern part of country and that all 17 people on board died in crash; Taliban claims responsibility, but officials say crash was due to technical problems.
lead_paragraph: The Ministry of Defense blamed technical problems for the crash, but a Taliban spokesman said that insurgents had shot it down.

headline.main: Afghan Army Helicopter Crashes, Killing All 17 Aboard
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Afghanistan: 17 Die in Crash of Army Helicopter

snippet: The Ministry of Defense blamed technical problems for the crash, but a Taliban spokesman said that insurgents had shot it down.
